record.description: Asia Lecture Series at the University of Chicago 25 to 29 May 1949. The 25th annual institute of the Norman Wait Harris Memorial Foundation in International Relations dealt with Nationalism and Regionalism in South Asia. Delegates seated on the steps of the International House, front: Professor Benoy Sarkar, Department of Economics, Calcutta University; and Mr. Soedjatmoko, Indonesian delegate to the United Nations Security Council; rear: Quincy Wright, professor of international law and chairman of the Memorial Foundation committee; J. S. Furnivall, adviser to the government of the Union of Burma; Cora DuBois, Division of Research for Far East, U.S. Department of State; and Phillips Talbot, director of the 1949 Institute, and visiting assistant professor of political science.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Attached caption, Acme written on it.
